main event: A large ball of fire was observed traveling through the air at low altitude near Collins, Ontario on May 5, 1961.
interesting points: The observation lasted for 15 minutes, The ball of fire was estimated to be at an altitude of 3,000 to 4,000 feet, The weather at the time was reported to be low overcast at 3,000 feet, The object was seen traveling from east to west at a good speed, Ground radar tracked the object but it was still unclear if it was a ballistic missile or aircraft.
witness description: A male observer reporting from a pond located approximately half a mile from Collins.
